title: Maw talisman
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Transforms the user's midsection into a giant mouth, gnashing and ready to devour foes. The mouth may devour slain creatures, healing the user to an extent increased by the user's Shapeshifting skill and the power of the creature eaten. Skill also increases the damage done by the maw. |

[![Maw talisman.png](/images/7/71/Maw_talisman.png)](/File:Maw_talisman.png) A **maw talisman** is a [talisman](/Talisman "Talisman") that changes you into **Maw Form**, which adds a giant, gnashing mouth in place of the stomach.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Useful Info

When e**V**oked, a maw talisman turns you into Maw Form, which lasts until you end the form. Entering or exiting a form takes 5 turns.

Maw Form has the following effects:

**Combat Bonuses**

- **[Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat"):** 5 base damage.

- **Maw aux attack:** Adds a biting [auxiliary attack](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack"). Whenever you make a melee attack, weapon or not, you have a flat 75% chance to make a maw attack. Unlike other aux attacks, this chance is not impacted by XL. Damage scales linearly with Shapeshifting skill:

  - Below minimum: 3 damage (0 skill) - 12 damage (10 skill)
  - Above minimum: 12 damage (10 skill) - 20 damage (19 skill) ; +0.8 damage per level

- **Devour on kill:** Whenever you kill a enemy that can drop a [corpse](/Corpse "Corpse") in melee, you have an independent 66% chance to devour it, healing you. You'll heal the *lesser of* `HD + 1d(HD)` or `Shapeshifting + 1d20`. You don't need to make a maw attack to devour.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
  - [Beogh](/Beogh "Beogh") followers will not devour [orcs](/List_of_orcs "List of orcs"). [Gozag](/Gozag "Gozag") turns corpses into gold, stopping this effect. [Death drops](/Death_drop "Death drop") still generate, so you won't miss out on [dragon scales](/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales") and the like. However, [Animate Dead](/Animate_Dead "Animate Dead") and [Infestation](/Infestation "Infestation") don't function if you devour.

**Restrictions**

- **[Melded Gear](/Transformation#Useful_Info "Transformation"):** [Body armour](/Body_armour "Body armour").

Maw Form does not block any [mutations](/Mutation "Mutation"), does not change your [size](/Size "Size"), and gives no innate bonus to HP / [AC](/AC "AC").

Maw Form has a minimum [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting") skill of 10, below which you get an [HP penalty](/Talisman#Skill "Talisman"), and the maw's damage scales down. It has a maximum skill of 19, where skill has no further impact.

## Strategy

The maw [auxiliary attack](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack") doesn't care about how hard you hit, but the faster you swing, the more maw attacks you'll proc. Therefore, it works best on fast weapons. Skilled Unarmed Combat is obvious, but it also works well with [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades") and [demon whips](/Demon_whip "Demon whip").

## History

- Maw talismans were introduced in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), along with talismans themselves. Maw Form had no previous counterpart.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [melee-attack.cc:781](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31-b1/crawl-ref/source/melee-attack.cc#L781) (0.31-b1)

|                                   | [Transformations](/Transformation "Transformation")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| --------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Talisman](/Talisman "Talisman")  | [Beast Form](/Beast_Form "Beast Form") • [Flux Form](/Flux_Form "Flux Form") • [Blade Form](/Blade_Form "Blade Form") • [Maw Form](/Maw_Form "Maw Form") • [Serpent Form](/Serpent_Form "Serpent Form") • [Dragon Form](/Dragon_Form "Dragon Form") • [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form") • [Death Form](/Death_Form "Death Form") • [Storm Form](/Storm_Form "Storm Form") |
| [Bad Forms](/Bad_Form "Bad Form") | [Bat Form](/Bat_Form "Bat Form") • [Fungus Form](/Fungus_Form "Fungus Form") • [Pig Form](/Pig_Form "Pig Form") • [Tree Form](/Tree_Form "Tree Form") • [Wisp Form](/Wisp_Form "Wisp Form")                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| [Divine](/God "God")              | [Shadow Form](/Shadow_Form "Shadow Form")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
html:
Maw talisman

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Transforms the user's midsection into a giant mouth, gnashing and ready to devour foes. The mouth may devour slain creatures, healing the user to an extent increased by the user's Shapeshifting skill and the power of the creature eaten. Skill also increases the damage done by the maw.

A maw talisman is a talisman that changes you into Maw Form, which adds a giant, gnashing mouth in place of the stomach.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 References

Useful Info

When eVoked, a maw talisman turns you into Maw Form, which lasts until you end the form. Entering or exiting a form takes 5 turns.

Maw Form has the following effects:

Combat Bonuses

  • Unarmed Combat: 5 base damage.
  • Maw aux attack: Adds a biting auxiliary attack. Whenever you make a melee attack, weapon or not, you have a flat 75% chance to make a maw attack. Unlike other aux attacks, this chance is not impacted by XL. Damage scales linearly with Shapeshifting skill:
    • Below minimum: 3 damage (0 skill) - 12 damage (10 skill)
    • Above minimum: 12 damage (10 skill) - 20 damage (19 skill) ; +0.8 damage per level
  • Devour on kill: Whenever you kill a enemy that can drop a corpse in melee, you have an independent 66% chance to devour it, healing you. You'll heal the lesser of HD + 1d(HD) or Shapeshifting + 1d20. You don't need to make a maw attack to devour.[1]
    • Beogh followers will not devour orcs. Gozag turns corpses into gold, stopping this effect. Death drops still generate, so you won't miss out on dragon scales and the like. However, Animate Dead and Infestation don't function if you devour.

Restrictions

  • Melded Gear: Body armour.

Maw Form does not block any mutations, does not change your size, and gives no innate bonus to HP / AC.

Maw Form has a minimum Shapeshifting skill of 10, below which you get an HP penalty, and the maw's damage scales down. It has a maximum skill of 19, where skill has no further impact.

Strategy

The maw auxiliary attack doesn't care about how hard you hit, but the faster you swing, the more maw attacks you'll proc. Therefore, it works best on fast weapons. Skilled Unarmed Combat is obvious, but it also works well with Short Blades and demon whips.

History

  • Maw talismans were introduced in 0.31, along with talismans themselves. Maw Form had no previous counterpart.

References

  1. ↑ melee-attack.cc:781 (0.31-b1)
